title: Household rent to income ratio in the United Kingdom ( UK ) 2018 - 2019 , by region
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Rent to income ratio on the Y-axis for 14 different Regions for 2 groups Oct' 18, and Oct '19 that are presented on the X-axis.
Region London had the maximum Rent to income ratio among all 2 groups, and it was for Oct' 18. The minimum Rent to income ratio was observed in Region Yorkshire & Humber for Oct' 18.
There is a gap of 340.0 between the highest and lowest Rent to income ratio found for Oct' 18 in Region London and Yorkshire & Humber.
On average, the Region London had the highest Rent to income ratio for all 2 groups Oct' 18, and Oct '19. Whereas North East had the lowest average Rent to income ratio.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Rent to income ratio on the Y-axis for 14 different Regions for 2 groups Oct' 18, and Oct '19 that are presented on the X-axis.
For Region London, Oct' 18 had the highest Rent to income ratio 366.0 among the 2 groups and in Yorkshire & Humber, Oct' 18 had the lowest Rent to income ratio 26.0.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Rent to income ratio on the Y-axis for 14 different Regions for 2 groups Oct' 18, and Oct '19 that are presented on the X-axis.
Region London had the maximum Rent to income ratio among all 2 groups, and it was for Oct' 18. The minimum Rent to income ratio was observed in Region Yorkshire & Humber for Oct' 18.
There is a gap of 340.0 between the highest and lowest Rent to income ratio found for Oct' 18 in Region London and Yorkshire & Humber.
On average, the Region London had the highest Rent to income ratio for all 2 groups Oct' 18, and Oct '19. Whereas North East had the lowest average Rent to income ratio.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 14 different Regions on X-axis for 2 groups Oct' 18, and Oct '19. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Rent to income ratio.
Out of all 2 groups, Oct' 18 had the highest Rent to income ratio for Region London and Oct' 18 had the lowest Rent to income ratio for Region Yorkshire & Humber.
For Region London, Oct' 18 had the maximum Rent to income ratio and it saw the lowest in Region Yorkshire & Humber out of all 14 Regions.
There is a gap of 340.0 between the highest and lowest Rent to income ratio found for Oct' 18 in Region London and Yorkshire & Humber.
Out of all 2 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Rent to income ratio was found in case of Oct' 18.
Averaging all 2 groups Oct' 18, and Oct '19, the Region London is the maximum Rent to income ratio and North East is the minimum Rent to income ratio.
